organizations.title: Cancer and Patient Services
organizations.description: Lead and attended events such as patient visits and service trips to the local hospital and patient homes. Focus is to assist in small errands such as gardening and practice connecting with patients and ensuring comfort throughout treatment. We also help connect patients with local resources such as affordable long-term places to stay and transportation services during their treatment stay at the Dartmouth Medical Center.

organizations.title: Global China Connection - Dandelion Project
organizations.description: Dartmouth's Global China Connection seeks to raise awareness for the problems facing Chinese citizens and promote action. The Dandelion project is the fieldwork sector; we focus on the Dandelion Middle School (a school for children of migrant workers) located in rural Beijing.As Director of Marketing and Grants I am responsible for raising money to send Dartmouth students on teaching trips to the Dandelion Middle School by applying to grants and networking with Dartmouth alums and individuals interested in addressing the hukou education problem in China. This includes creating information packets to send to sponsors and possible donors about our progress and impact in China.

organizations.title: Dartmouth Smart Woman Securities
organizations.description: Dartmouth Smart Woman Securities (SWS) is an group that prepares females with the skills necessary to make sound investment decisions. Members are trained with global market education, real-world financial experience, practice stock pitches, and exposure to industry professionals. To become part of SWS I completed a 10 week seminar series. During this 10 week series I learned to evaluate stocks, companies, and industries as a whole, including researching, compiling, and writing industry reports. The series culminated in an investment project and presentation. The industry my team focused on was the banking and finance industry.

organizations.title: Dartmouth Women In Business
organizations.description: Women in Business educates the females at Dartmouth about what it means to be in business by supporting, educating, and providing a network for its members. Members are taught how to network, communicate, and find opportunities.

organizations.title: D.R.E.A.M. (Directing through Recreation, Education, And Mentoring)
organizations.description: Plan group and one-on-one mentoring activities for children from less privileged backgrounds for Dartmouth D.R.E.A.M. Mentors seek to help their mentees build self-confidence, explore interests, and learn conflict management skills.My favorite experience was face painting; one of the mentees was a big fan of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles so I painted a her favorite character on her arm to match her new shirt.

organizations.title: The Dartmouth
organizations.description: The Dartmouth (inc.), founded in 1799, it is America's oldest college newspaper. As a comic artist I helped provide a fun take on campus events.

honors_and_awards.title: NH Space Grant
honors_and_awards.description: A grant provided by the NH Space Grant Consortium (a NASA Space Grant Consortium) to help fund research done at the Jet Propulsion Laboratory. Amount: over $5300
